intro: Stachys tenoreana, commonly known as the Tenore's hedge nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the island of Sicily. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and range in color from pink to purple, blooming from summer to autumn. Stachys tenoreana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate.
